AbstractText.sentence: A role in thymic maturation for factors of the NF-kappaB family has long been suspected, but not yet proven.

event.clue: A role in thymic maturation for factors of the NF-kappaB family has long been suspected, but not yet proven.

AbstractText.sentence: Transgenic mice with a lymphocyte-specific defect in NF-kappaB activation were produced by targeted expression of human IkappaB alpha.

event.clue: Transgenic mice with a lymphocyte-specific defect in NF-kappaB activation were produced by targeted expression of human IkappaB alpha.

AbstractText.sentence: The thymic cellularity of these mice was significantly decreased.

event.clue: The thymic cellularity of these mice was significantly decreased.

AbstractText.sentence: The proportion of mature, TCRhigh thymocytes of the alphabeta lineage was reduced, and the remaining TCRhigh population contained an unusually high proportion of double-positive cells.

event.clue: The proportion of mature, TCRhigh thymocytes of the alphabeta lineage was reduced, and the remaining TCRhigh population contained an unusually high proportion of double-positive cells.

AbstractText.sentence: This defect in maturation resulted in a transgene dose-dependent reduction in peripheral T lymphocytes, with the CD8 lineage being more severely affected.

AbstractText.sentence: These data provide direct evidence for the involvement of NF-kappaB/Rel family proteins in late stages of T lymphocyte development, coincident with positive and negative selection.
